alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 01 at 9:28AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: .A thunderstorm complex will develop in northeast Colorado this afternoon and move across areas north of Interstate 70 tonight. These thunderstorms may produce excessive rainfall amounts in a short amount of time resulting in flash flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM MDT /7 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a * Flood Watch for portions of Colorado, northwest Kansas, and southwest Nebraska, including the following areas, in Colorado, Kit Carson and Yuma. In northwest Kansas, Cheyenne, Decatur, Rawlins, Sherman, and Thomas. In southwest Nebraska, Dundy, Hitchcock, and Red Willow. * From 6 PM MDT /7 PM CDT/ this evening through late tonight * Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on current forecasts. Monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible flood warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
